content: christmas tree ornament by karina rose for color happy handmades a quick fun little project a great stash buster supplies yarn in two colors color a pictured dark green and aspen color b white or light green or… the sample pictured on the left was made with hobbii rainbow cotton 8/4 which is a #1 superfine though it feels a bit thicker than that and the one on the right was made with stylecraft special dk you can make it in any weight yarn just switch the hook to a size appropriate to the yarn your ornament will just be a bit bigger or smaller you only use a small amount of yarn about 45 yards of the main color maybe 20 of the highlight color hook i used a 2 5 mm c crochet hook for the thin cotton yarn and a 3 0 mm d for the dk version tapestry needle needle thin enough to go through your bead and thick enough to thread your yarn on it one bead i used crystal beads for these but their holes are a bit small so it was a little fiddley to get the yarn through i would suggest something with a larger hole stitch marker gauge not important my finished ornaments in the 8/4 cotton yarn are about 3 25 tall excluding the bead and hanging loop in the dk yarn about 3 5 tall stitches us terms chain chain sl slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet triple crochet blo back loop only these are stitches worked into the back loop of the v of the stitch instead of both loops in this pattern you will be doing blo treble_crochet back loop only triple crochet increase increase place 2 stitches in the same stitch to increase general notes you will be working in a spiral so not joining rounds mark your first stitch with a stitch marker color happy handmades © 2022 p ag e | 1 instructions between ** will be repeated stitches in parentheses for example 2 treble_crochet will be done in the same stitch numbers in parentheses at the end of the row for example 6 indicate how many stitches you should have in the row you will start from the top of the tree and create a cone shape with back loop only stitches you will then work back up the cone using the remaining loops to create the branches then from the top down to create the snow foundation cone row 1 start with color a and a magic loop leaving a long 12 tail to be used later to make the hanging loop chain 2 this does not count as a stitch 6 double_crochet in the ring 6 you will be working in a spiral so you will not be joining rounds you will want to mark your first stitch of each row with a marker keep moving the marker as you go from this point all stitches will be worked
